title: How to Make the Twelfth Night Tart with Nutella

steps.headline: Line the baking sheet with a piece of baking parchment.
Unroll the two ready rolled puff pastry sheets.
Place one of the ready rolled puff pasty sheets on the baking sheet leaving about an inch overlap of pastry on the baking sheet and set aside.
In a medium bowl, add the Nutella, ground hazelnuts and eggs.
Using a spoon stir until well combined.
Using the back of a spoon, spread the pastry you prepared earlier with the Nutella mixture.
steps.description: This can also be done carefully with a butter knife. For a little added fun, place a lucky charm or dried bean somewhere on the Nutella mixture to be found later by a lucky guest.

steps.headline: Take the remaining puff pastry and place it on top of mixture on the baking tray.
Join the edges by firmly pressing them together all around to seal the two pieces of pastry together.
Brush the egg yolk all over the prepared pastry making sure to coat it completely and evenly.
steps.description: For an added decorative touch, use the tip of a knife to create a criss-cross pattern on the top of the tart.

steps.headline: Put into the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until the pastry is well risen and brown.

text: Preheat the oven to 425°F.  Line the baking sheet with a piece of baking parchment.  Unroll the two ready rolled puff pastry sheets.  Place one of the ready rolled puff pasty sheets on the baking sheet leaving about an inch overlap of pastry on the baking sheet and set aside.  In a medium bowl, add the Nutella, ground hazelnuts and eggs.  Using a spoon stir until well combined.  Using the back of a spoon, spread the pastry you prepared earlier with the Nutella mixture. This can also be done carefully with a butter knife. For a little added fun, place a lucky charm or dried bean somewhere on the Nutella mixture to be found later by a lucky guest. Take the remaining puff pastry and place it on top of mixture on the baking tray.  Join the edges by firmly pressing them together all around to seal the two pieces of pastry together.  Brush the egg yolk all over the prepared pastry making sure to coat it completely and evenly. For an added decorative touch, use the tip of a knife to create a criss-cross pattern on the top of the tart. Put into the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until the pastry is well risen and brown.  Let cool before serving.
